page.title: 03INDUSTRY AND INSTITUTIONS
page.content: The towns main industry in the 19th century was the shipbuilding industry. Between{1840}and{1883,}75 ships were built in the town the last being the { {Cadwgan}in{1883.}Other industries slate, timber, commerce, bacon cutting stores, a grain business, manufacture of edge tools, woollen factory, leather works, smithies and a tannery. Today, many of these industries are gone and tourism and agriculture play an important role in our working life. {ABERAERON'S INSTITUTIONS 1833 Tabernacle Methodist Chapel opens 1839 Aberaeron Workhouse opens 1840 Town Hall opens 1848 National School opens 1872 British School built 1880 Aeron Express opens 1898 Aberaeron County School Opens 1911 Aberaeron-Lampeter railway opened May 12th - closed May 7th 1951.
